de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.matrices

Interface LabeledMatrix<LabelType>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Addable<Matrix>, AdditivelyInvertible<Matrix>, Invertible<Matrix>, Matrix, MultiDimensional<Matrix>, Multipliable<Matrix>, Ring<Matrix>, Subtractable<Matrix>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LabeledRegularMatrix, LabeledSymmetricMatrix

    public interface LabeledMatrix<LabelType>
extends Matrix
    The LabeledMatrix provides possibilities to define labels that point to a value inside of the matrix. Labels can be set for rows and columns and a value from the matrix can be retrieved by giving a combination of row and column label.

      • getPositionFromLabels

        Pair<java.lang.Integer> getPositionFromLabels(LabelType rowLabel,
                                              LabelType columnLabel)
        Returns a Pair of Integers that represent the position of a value that is assigned to the given labels. As a contract the Pair.getFirst() method will retrieve the row index and the Pair.getSecond() method the column index. FIXME seems to be broken due to usage of IdentityHashMap
        Parameters:
        rowLabel - The row label.
        columnLabel - The column label.
        Returns:
        The position of the value as defined by the labels.

      • getValueFromPosition

        double getValueFromPosition(Pair<java.lang.Integer> position)
        Returns a value using the position given by a Pair of Integers. As a contract the Pair.getFirst() method will be interpreted as the row index and the Pair.getSecond() method as the column index.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of a value.
        Returns:
        The actual value from the matrix.

      • getStringRepresentation

        java.lang.String getStringRepresentation()
        Returns a string representation of the labelled matrix such that a CSV compatible format is achieved. Numbers are rounded to 6 decimal places to keep visual layout.

        The following symmetric matrix with the labels L1, L2, L3 result in the following string representation: 

         ,L1,L2,L3
 L1,1.000000,2.000000,3.000000
 L2,2.000000,4.000000,5.000000
 L3,3.000000,5.000000,8.000000
        Returns:
        a CSV-like string representation
